instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi to all you nice people
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with a non working keyboard , all keys (I mean all) are not responding . The board is like new , no corrosion or oxidation at all . I have seen these boards with some keys not working
or sticky or .... but never with a complete keyboard totally non responsive .
I replaced the keyboard cable just in case but that didnt help .
On the keyboard connector J4500 I have measured the following :
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_KBD</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>     = 3.31 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>        = 3.31 V

Any help how to proceed is much appreciated ... I have still hard time accepting all of the keyboard just gave up , I think it is possible but ....

Thanks for any help in advance

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
Trackpad works, only no keyboard?

Before login into OSX, still no keyboard?
Try to access boot menu.

Keyboard connects with trackpad and communication with PCH is done through trackpad circuitry.
So try known good trackpad board/flex too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos 
yes thats the confusing part , the trackpad works great . Before osx same thing no keyboard , tried to reset smc but nothing ......

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
Check all traces between TP and KB connectors.

Also,
"So try known good trackpad board/flex too."
did that?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
Hi 2 informaticos 
took me a day to find another trackpad cable (corona is making it difficult) and just got it and replaced it with a new and exactly the same result .....
I would hate to (try) to replace the keyboard in this  model it looks really like a whole night job and the result is not given as I understood from some 
that have tried it .....
Still the trackpad works and the keyboard nada ..... :(

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2017 no keyboard
threads.message:
This keyboard has electronic circuitry embedded on it.
Is the only thing remained to try/change.
Suerte...
